snippet: A thorough investigation of rate-manipulation will need to answer questions about what the authorities knew about rate-rigging and when they knew it.
abstract: Editorial contends that disclosures made by deposed Barclays chief executive Robert Diamond Jr regarding the bank's attempts to rig benchmark interest rates speak to the overly cozy relationship between authorities and bankers before, during and since the financial crisis in 2008; calls for a thorough investigation of banks that also answers questions about what the authorities knew about rate-rigging and when they knew it.
lead_paragraph: A thorough investigation of rate-manipulation will need to answer questions about what the authorities knew about rate-rigging and when they knew it.
